subject: Re: about[junit] how to test Objects,private Methods
msgSnippet: ... You should know exactly what object you will receive.  So create another instance of the object, initiliaze it properly and do an assertEquals betwee the
messageBody:
>
>
>1) how to check the objects return by a function....
>
You should know exactly what object you will receive. So create another
instance of the object, initiliaze it properly and do an "assertEquals"
betwee the two objects

>2) how to check the private methods.....
>
Long discussion... A point of view is that you should not need to test
private methods. You make sure that the public interface of your class
works properly. The internal cooking is not important and can be
changed without modifying the public behaviour of your class. If you
have tons of private methods, think of writing a new class with these
methods and make them public.

-Vladimir
